intro: Brownea longipedicellata, commonly known as the pink woodbine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
